name: glancingly
content:
glancingly adverb
(TOUCH)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that involves hitting or touching something quickly and lightly at an angle: The sword struck glancingly, inflicting no damage. He kissed her on the forehead and then glancingly on the lips. Related word
glancing
More examplesFewer examplesThe pick struck the rock glancingly.

glancingly adverb
(REFER TO)
in a way that is not detailed, clear, or direct, or that makes something seem to lack importance: The darker moments were referred to only glancingly. He alludes to their anger, but glancingly. Synonym
obliquely (not direct)
More examplesFewer examplesHe mentions these writers only glancingly, or in cursory footnotes.As the author glancingly but provocatively suggests, this information allows for an entirely different perspective.She skims, glancingly, over the issue that is actually the most important one.
